title.value: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery

extractions.description: This paper explores the intrinsic relationship between music discovery and popularity bias, and proposes a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach to address popularity bias in graph neural network (GNN) based recommender systems. The approach leverages musical similarity for more accurate and fair music recommendations.

type.justification: The study involves extensive evaluation of the proposed methodology on two music datasets, showing empirical results.
type.quote: Through a series of empirical results, we show that our fairness framework enables us to outperform a series of accepted fairness benchmarks in both performance and recommendation of lesser known content on two important music recommendation tasks.

name.justification: The research is focused on improving music recommendation systems by mitigating popularity bias.
name.quote: As online music platforms grow, music recommender systems play a vital role in helping users navigate and discover content within their vast musical databases.

name.justification: The paper addresses fairness specifically in the context of music recommender systems.
name.quote: To mitigate this issue we propose a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach which addresses popularity bias in graph neural network (GNNs) based recommender systems.

name.justification: PinSage is mentioned as one of the methods used in the study.
name.quote: In particular, PinSage [67] is an industry solution to graph-based recommendation.

name.justification: LightGCN is utilized as one of the backbone recommenders for the fairness mitigation techniques.
name.quote: Since its proposal in 2020, it is still considered state of the art.

name.justification: BERT is used for embedding song titles.
name.quote: We extract the song title and pass it through a pre-trained language transformer model, BERT [19], into an embedding of dimension 512.

name.justification: ResNet50 is used for embedding album artworks.
name.quote: We pass this image through a pre-trained convolutional neural network, ResNet50 [33], to generate an embedding of dimension 1024.

name.justification: BOOST is introduced in the paper as a novel technique to mitigate popularity bias.
name.quote: To extend this technique for explicitly counteracting popularity bias, we define the BOOST technique which is used to further increase the penalty on misrepresentation of items that come from diverse popularity categories.

name.justification: LastFM is one of the datasets used for evaluation in the research paper.
name.quote: we extensively augment two publicly available datasets: LastFM [46] and the Million Playlist Dataset [16]

name.justification: MPD is one of the datasets used for evaluation in the research paper.
name.quote: we extensively augment two publicly available datasets: LastFM [46] and the Million Playlist Dataset [16]

name.justification: PyTorch is used for implementing the deep learning models in the study.
name.quote: All details and further hyperparameter settings can be found on our GitHub repository

name.justification: Spotipy is used for extracting features from Spotify in the research study.
name.quote: We augment both of our datasets to include a rich set of features scraped from Spotify API [1].
